titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marguerite V. Doggett papers 1980.012
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-05-10 15:13:53 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Marguerite V. Doggett papers primarily consist of an unedited manuscript of her book, "Long Island Printing, 1791-1830: A Checklist of Imprints." Also included are press releases, reviews, and correspondence concerning the book, which was printed in 1978 by the Long Island Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1980.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into nine folders by type.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Marguerite V. Doggett papers, 1980.012, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Marguerite V. Doggett papers primarily consist of an unedited manuscript of her book, "Long Island Printing, 1791-1830: A Checklist of Imprints." Also included are press releases, reviews, and correspondence concerning the book, which was printed in 1978 by the Long Island Historical Society. Each printer documented in the book is listed chronologically by county, and town within county, with biographies of each of the printers. An appendix provides a list of authors associated with the printing industry in Long Island.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
